thread.title: What amazing parents I have had
thread.title_full: What amazing parents I have had | News24

author: news24.com
title: What amazing parents I have had
text:
When I hear students protesting at wits , while normal classes are being interrupted and then to read the nonsense spewed by young people and their ever questionable mindset.
I need to share my blessed up bringing .
For all my most passionate thoughts and for all my ideals that I may have had given me, one thing is constant in my memory.
This world owes you nothing! Nothing at all. A free education makes sense and nobody can argue its importance. But when it comes down to the reality of it an education is most certainly a privilege. As for people telling themselves it is a right well good luck!
Who are your parents? Do they flatter you and tell you the world owes you something?
As a child I would tell me dad how unfair a matter was and he would smile at me and tell me how unfair life is. He never budged and bless my good dad he lives still and even at the age of 40 when my questionable decisions have left me vulnerable. My dad will still tell me what he told me when I was young.
Work gentlemen, work... I remember complaining about the government once and he asked me, "Is there a law that says you may not become a millionaire? " I said no and he said "shut up and work gentleman."
I love my father so much. He never ever lied to me. He still doesn't.
If your parents tell you that someone owes you something in this world. Then first look at their lives and see what they achieved. See the excuses they have and the excuses they still make.
My dad came here in tough times, he couldn't speak any English.
People talk about inequality, its the quality of parents we have.
Yes, Wits is expensive and probably should cater for the poor. But lets get practical and change the way we think. Protesting is just protesting, it does not solve the problem.
Vote for leaders that make your rand go further.
Vote for leaders that do not buy expensive cars .
Vote for a better future. No whites in SA owe anybody anything.
They are part of the freedom that we all have.
If your parents have nothing , blame them. Don't blame others .
God says that all the silver and all the gold is his.
Make your prayers and supplications known when you wake up and live with expectation.
I cannot blame anybody for my failures and nor can you!
